entries.label: Dadra & Nagar Haveli and Daman & Diu
The Dadra And Nagar Haveli And Daman And Diu
Ministry Of Social Justice and Empowerment
Ministry Of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
Ministry Of Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises
Ministry of Fisheries,Animal Husbandry and Dairying
Ministry Of New and Renewable Energy
Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology
Ministry of Women and Child Development
Ministry Of Skill Development And Entrepreneurship
Ministry Of Personnel, Public Grievances And Pensions
Ministry Of Petroleum and Natural Gas
Comptroller And Auditor General Of India
Ministry Of Environment,forests and climate change
Ministry Of Consumer Affairs, Food And Public Distribution
Ministry Of Development Of North Eastern Region
Ministry Of Statistics and Programme Implementation
NITI Aayog (National Institution for Transforming India)

fields.schemeName: Planning for Best Livestock Keeper's Award Function
fields.briefDescription: The "Planning for Best Livestock Keeper's Award Function" scheme by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Cooperation Department honors outstanding pastoralists in Gujarat by awarding them at Taluka, District, and State levels for their excellence in animal husbandry.

fields.schemeName: Stipend To Students Studying at Govt. Hindi Institute Dimapur
fields.briefDescription: The scheme aims to provide financial support to students enrolled at the Government Hindi Institute, Dimapur. Under this scheme, a monthly stipend of ₹400/- is given to student every year from the allocated scholarship fund provided by the State Government.

fields.schemeName: Mukhyamantri Atyant Pichhda Varg Medhavriti Yojana
fields.briefDescription: The scheme aims to provide ₹10,000/- as a one-time scholarship to extremely backward class students passing class 10th in the first division from the Bihar School Examination Board.

fields.schemeName: Establishment of Goat Unit (10 +1)
fields.briefDescription: The "Establishment of Goat Unit (10+1)" scheme by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Cooperation Department, Gujarat, aims to promote the social and economic upliftment of goat breeders by encouraging goat breeding and genetic improvement through pure breeding.

fields.schemeName: Arunachal Pradesh State Stipend Scheme
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, provide financial support to scheduled tribe (ST) students pursuing higher and technical education through stipends and book grants.

fields.schemeName: Capital Subsidy Scheme for Setting Up Solar Plant in Milk Cooperatives in Gujarat State (Tribal Area)
fields.briefDescription: The scheme aims to promote renewable energy and reduce electricity expenses. Through this scheme, a 75% subsidy is provided for setting up solar plants (1KW to 40KW) in milk cooperative societies in tribal areas.

fields.schemeName: Assistance in Packing Materials under Post Harvest Management of Horticultural Produce
fields.briefDescription: The scheme provides financial assistance to farmers to procure packing materials like corrugated and wooden boxes for post-harvest management of horticultural produce.

fields.schemeName: Assistance Program for Planting in Floriculture
fields.briefDescription: The scheme offers financial assistance to farmers in Gujarat for the cultivation of floriculture crops, including loose, cut, and tuberous flowers, based on crop type and farmer category.

fields.schemeName: Assistance for Area Expansion of Spice Crops
fields.briefDescription: The scheme provides financial assistance to farmers for the area expansion of spice crops, including seed and rhizomatic spices, to enhance spice production in Gujarat.

fields.schemeName: Housing Assistance Grant
fields.briefDescription: “Housing Assistance Grant” is a social security scheme that provides financial assistance for the construction/ repair of houses to the widows, dependents of martyred soldiers, and those soldiers who have become physically disabled in various wars, border skirmishes, and internal security.

fields.schemeName: Grant for Purchase and Repair of Various Assistive Devices/Equipment for Persons with Disabilities
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, a grant of up to ₹3,500 is provided for the purchase of individual aids, which may be increased to a maximum of ₹7,000 in special cases. Additionally, ₹500 is provided for the repair of prosthetic limbs and other assistive equipment.

fields.schemeName: Atma Nirbhar Matsya Palan Yojana
fields.briefDescription: The scheme aims to provide a 45% subsidy with credit linkage for fishery infrastructure to ST individuals, SHGs, and FPOs engaged in aquaculture.

fields.schemeName: Pandit Dindayal Upadhyay Awas Yojana-Developing Caste Welfare
fields.briefDescription: The "Pandit Dindayal Upadhyay Awas Yojana-Developing Caste Welfare" provides financial assistance of up to ₹1,20,000/- to socially and educationally backward classes, economically backward classes, and nomadic exempted castes for constructing houses across Gujarat.

fields.schemeName: Old Age Pension for the Construction Workers (On Completion Of 65 Years) (UKBOCWWB)
fields.briefDescription: “Old Age Pension for the Construction Workers (On Completion Of 65 Years)’’ is a social security scheme that provides a monthly pension of ₹1,500/- per month to the beneficiaries to the eligible workers of the board who have completed 65 years of age.

fields.schemeName: Pension Scheme for Artisans
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, an additional monthly incentive of ₹400/- is provided to senior artisans aged 60 or above who are already receiving old-age pension and belong to below-poverty-line (BPL) families.

fields.schemeName: Parityakta Pension Scheme
fields.briefDescription: The scheme aims to provide a monthly pension to Abandoned married women, mentally ill husband/wife & destitute unmarried women in the state. Under this scheme, beneficiaries receive a pension of ₹1,200/- per month, & in case of mental disability (spouse), the amount is ₹1,400/- per month.

fields.schemeName: Eja-Boi Shagun Yojana
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, a cash gift of ₹2,000 /- would be paid to those women who ensured 48 hours stay for delivery of their child in the government hospitals or health care centres.

fields.schemeName: Uttarakhand Shaheed Kosh Anudan Yojana
fields.briefDescription: The scheme provides a one-time grant of ₹10,00,000 to widows/dependents of martyred soldiers or paramilitary personnel.

fields.schemeName: Minority Self-Employment Scheme
fields.briefDescription: “Minority Self-Employment Scheme” is a social security scheme by the Minority Welfare Department, Government of Uttarakhand, that provides financial assistance through facilitating loans to the minority community to build their own employment.

fields.schemeName: Loan for Training of Commercial Pilot (GUEEDC)
fields.briefDescription: The scheme "Loan for Training of Commercial Pilot (GUEEDC)" by the Social Justice and Empowerment Department, Gujarat, provides financial loan assistance of up to ₹25,00,000/- at 4% simple interest per annum is provided to Unreserved category candidates for pursuing commercial pilot training.

fields.schemeName: Samaveshit Shiksha Yojana
fields.briefDescription: "Samaveshit Shiksha Yojana"  aims to provide inclusive education support and special facilities to children with special needs aged 6 to 18 years studying in government schools from Classes 1 to 12.

fields.schemeName: Pashupalan Dhiran Yojana
fields.briefDescription: "Pashupalan Dhiran Yojana" by the Social Justice and Empowerment Department provides loan assistance for animal husbandry to Rabari and Bharwad castes from the socially and educationally backward classes.

fields.schemeName: Financial Assistance Scheme for Dependents of Deceased Journalists and Litterateurs - Rajasthan
fields.briefDescription: The scheme aims to provide financial support to the dependents of deceased journalists and litterateurs in situations such as medical emergencies, unemployment, or when there is no other source of income.

fields.schemeName: Jan Samuh Bima Yojana
fields.briefDescription: The scheme aims to provide financial assistance to Sahariya families in the event of the death of the heads of the families. Under this scheme, a one-time financial assistance of ₹25,000/- is provided by the insurance company to the deceased's family to help reduce their economic burden.

fields.schemeName: Indira Gandhi Matritva Poshan Yojana
fields.briefDescription: Under the scheme, women who conceive their second child and fulfill the prescribed conditions will receive cash assistance of ₹6,000/-, paid in five installments.

fields.schemeName: Cash Amount for Encouraging Scheduled Tribe Sportsperson Students
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, cash awards, certificates, and mementos are provided as a form of encouragement to Scheduled Tribe  sportsperson students who secure the top three positions in national and international sports events.

fields.schemeName: Operation of Ashram Hostels
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, free accommodation, nutritious meals, educational materials, uniforms, personal hygiene items, and other facilities are provided to Scheduled Tribe (ST) students residing in ashram hostels operated by the Tribal Area Development Department.

fields.schemeName: Samuhik Kanya Vivah Sahayata Yojana (UKBOCWWB)
fields.briefDescription: The scheme aims to support the marriage of daughters of construction workers by providing financial assistance of ₹61,000/- for their daughter’s marriage in a group marriage event.

fields.schemeName: Gargi Sanskrit Girl Student Scholarship Scheme
fields.briefDescription: The scheme provides financial assistance to girl students from Class 6 to 12 studying in Sanskrit institutions in Uttarakhand to promote Sanskrit education among female students.

fields.schemeName: National Centre for Communication Security (NCCS) Research Associates Scheme
fields.briefDescription: NCCS engages young scholars as Research Associates  to contribute in development of Telecom Security eco system with in India by providing an opportunity to them to work in areas like Telecom Security Standard development, Lab recognition and Security Certification of telecom products.

fields.schemeName: Model School under School Education
fields.briefDescription:
The scheme aims to provide inclusive quality education to children with visual disabilities from pre-school to senior secondary level.
Through this scheme, students receive free residential facilities, educational materials, assistive devices, and digital tools for a modern learning experience.

fields.schemeName: Rajya/Mukhyamantri Swarn/Rajat Padak Protsahan Puraskar
fields.briefDescription: This scheme awards cash incentives to NCC cadets who demonstrate outstanding performance in the current year's RDC, TSC, VSC, or NSC camps, recognizing six gold medal recipients with ₹3,000/- and six silver medal recipients with ₹2000/-.

fields.schemeName: Financial Assistance to Sports Associations/ Clubs/ Committees of Uttarakhand
fields.briefDescription: This scheme provides financial grants and assistance to recognized sports associations, clubs, and committees for organizing sports competitions at national, state, and district levels, and for purchasing sports equipment for selected players, benefiting around 20 sports bodies/players annually.

fields.schemeName: Chanakya Scheme for Swayam Upadhi
fields.briefDescription: The "Chanakya Scheme for Swayam Upadhi” to encourage Brahmin entrepreneurs in Andhra Pradesh. The grant will be given against relevant approved asset acquisition for setting up new business entities or expanding existing/diversifying business entities in different areas.

fields.schemeName: Braille Equipment Provision
fields.briefDescription: The "Braille Equipment Provision" scheme aims to empower persons with visual disabilities to live independently by supporting their writing, computing, mobility, and entertainment needs. Through this scheme, Braille equipment is manufactured and made available to individuals and institutions.

fields.schemeName: Livelihood Opportunity Promotion Scheme (Scheduled Tribes)
fields.briefDescription: The scheme aims to promote self-employment among Scheduled Tribe individuals through financial support, including loans, margin money, and grants.

fields.schemeName: Livelihood Opportunity Promotion Scheme (Scheduled Caste)
fields.briefDescription: The scheme aims to promote self-employment among Scheduled Castes. It provides financial aid, including loans, margin money, and grants, for livelihood projects.

fields.schemeName: License for Repairers of Weights-Measures and Weighing Instruments
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, a government-approved license is issued to repairers of weights and measuring instruments, enabling them to repair such instruments used by traders as a means of self-employment and to ensure their livelihood.

fields.schemeName: Establishment of Broiler Farms
fields.briefDescription: The primary objective of the scheme is to meet the growing demand for poultry production, generate employment opportunities, and ensure access to protein-rich food for the growing population.

fields.schemeName: Rural Technology Complex
fields.briefDescription: The scheme "Rural Technology Complex" by the Programme Implementation Department, Government of Uttarakhand, aims to enhance livelihood opportunities in the Himalayan region through the use of local, need-based and environment-friendly technologies.

fields.schemeName: Pradhan Mantri Mudra Yojana
fields.briefDescription: Pradhan Mantri Mudra Yojana (PMMY) is  a flagship scheme of Government of India. It facilitates micro credit/Loan upto Rs. 20 lakhs to income generating micro enterprises engaged in the non farm sector in manufacturing, processing, trading or service sector including activities allied to agriculture

fields.schemeName: Drone Policy
fields.briefDescription: The scheme "Drone Policy" by the Information Technology Development Agency, Government of Uttarakhand aims to promote drone-based service delivery, innovation in drone technology, and development of a supportive drone ecosystem.

fields.schemeName: Freeship less than ₹1,00,000 (UG students only)
fields.briefDescription: The scheme "Freeship Less than ₹1,00,000 only for UG students" by the Dean Student Welfare, GBPUAT, Pantnagar aims to support meritorious undergraduate students from low-income families. This Freeship scheme provides full tuition fee exemption to eligible students.

fields.schemeName: CSIR (PhD) Fellowship
fields.briefDescription: "CSIR Fellowship (PhD)" scheme by the Council of Scientific and Industrial Research, Government of India aims to support science research through financial assistance. Scholars receive a ₹31,000 monthly stipend for 2 years, directly transferred to their bank accounts.

fields.schemeName: Training and Tour Unit
fields.briefDescription: "Training and Tour Unit" scheme by the Department of Agriculture Extension, Government of Uttarakhand aims to provide agricultural training to farmers, rural youth, and extension workers through university-led programs and field tours.

fields.schemeName: Grant to Films - Films Shot in Uttarakhand with a Budget of Minimum ₹50 Crores or More
fields.briefDescription: The scheme aims to promote film shooting in the state, generate employment, support local and regional films and artists, and generate revenue for the state. The scheme offers up to ₹3 crore as financial assistance to film producers who shoot major parts of their films in Uttarakhand.

fields.schemeName: Grant to Films - Foreign Language Films
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, financial grants of up to 50% of in-state production expenditure or ₹3 crore are provided to foreign language films shot in Uttarakhand, provided they have incurred a minimum in-state expenditure exceeding ₹3 crore & accurately depict shooting locations within the state.

fields.schemeName: Grant to Films - Regional Dialects of Uttarakhand
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, grants and subsidies are provided to filmmakers and producers to cover expenses incurred during film production. Additional incentives are available for children’s films, and OTT-based projects are also eligible under specific conditions.

fields.schemeName: Sindhu Darshan Scheme
fields.briefDescription: The scheme aims to provide financial assistance of ₹15,000/- to pilgrims from Gujarat undertaking the Sindhu Darshan Yatra in Leh-Ladakh, fostering national unity. Intended beneficiaries include native Gujaratis who complete the yatra and apply within 60 days.

fields.schemeName: Uttarakhand State Andolankari Pension
fields.briefDescription: "Uttarakhand State Andolankari Pension" is a social welfare scheme implemented by the Department of Home, Government of Uttarakhand, that provides a monthly pension to the injured/jailed agitators during the Uttarakhand State Movement.

fields.schemeName: Mukhyamantri Alp-Shankhyak Protsahan Yojana
fields.briefDescription: The "Mukhyamantri Alp-Shankhyak Protsahan Yojana" aims to provide financial incentives to minority community candidates from Uttarakhand who clear preliminary exams and/or interviews for various competitive examinations like UPSC, Uttarakhand PSC, and national-level institutions (IITs & IIMs).

fields.schemeName: Free Training for Vehicle Drivers
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, free driving training is provided to scheduled caste and scheduled tribe candidates to improve driving skills and promote self-employment.

fields.schemeName: Uttarakhand Tourism Entrepreneur Promotion Scheme
fields.briefDescription: The scheme aims to aims to encourage and financially strengthen permanent residents/entrepreneurs of the state who invest ₹1 crore to ₹5 crore in the tourism sector.

fields.schemeName: Operation of River Rafting / Kayaking Activities
fields.briefDescription: The scheme aims to promote adventure tourism by regulating and authorizing rafting and kayaking operations in the state. Under this scheme, rafting companies are granted permission to operate, and licenses are issued to qualified river guides.

fields.schemeName: Deen Dayal Upadhyay Grah Aawas Vikas Yojana
fields.briefDescription: The Scheme aim to provide an unprecedented experience to domestic and foreign tourists visiting Uttarakhand, as well as for the prosperity of the local people. Now you can improve your financial condition by using your home as a tourist resting place.

fields.schemeName: Self-Employment Scheme for Scheduled Castes and Tribes
fields.briefDescription: The scheme aims to support scheduled castes and scheduled tribes families below the poverty line through concessional loans and subsidies for self-employment in various sectors.

fields.schemeName: Uniform Assistance for Scheduled Tribe Students
fields.briefDescription: The scheme "Uniform Assistance for Scheduled Tribe Students" by the Social Justice and Empowerment Department, Gujarat, provides ₹900/- for three pairs of uniforms to ST students in government and aided primary schools studying in Classes 1 to 8.

fields.schemeName: Dulari Scheme
fields.briefDescription: The DULARI Scheme was implemented by the Directorate of Health Services in the Andaman and Nicobar Islands to provide incentives for newborn baby girls and to the girl children who pass Classes VIII, X, and XII.

fields.schemeName: Financial Assistance for funeral and other activities in case of death of a worker's - Haryana Labour Welfare Board
fields.briefDescription: The scheme aims to provide financial support to the family or dependent of a deceased worker to cover funeral and related expenses. Under this scheme, an assistance amount of ₹15,000/- is provided to the dependent/family of the deceased worker.

fields.schemeName: Advance Authorisation(AA)
fields.briefDescription: Advance Authorisation scheme enables duty free import of inputs for export production, including replenishment of inputs or duty remission Advance Authorisation covers manufacturer exporters or merchant exporters tied to supporting manufacturer(s).

fields.schemeName: PMMSY: Fish Feed Plants of Production Capacity of at least 100 Ton/Day - Haryana
fields.briefDescription: This scheme provides capital subsidy for setting up fish feed plants with a minimum production capacity of 100 tons per day, under the Pradhan Mantri Matsya Sampada Yojana (PMMSY) to general , schedule caste and women beneficiaries .

fields.schemeName: Pradhan Mantri Matsya Sampada Yojana: Establishment of Backyard mini RAS Units - Haryana
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, financial assistance in the form of subsidies is provided to eligible beneficiaries for establishing these units. Various surface and groundwater sources such as canals, rivers, springs, open wells, and tube wells can be utilized for operating RAS units.

fields.schemeShortTitle: DEVELOPMENT SUPPORT FOR COFFEE ORGANIC CERTIFICATION / ECO CERTIFICATION / NATURAL FARMING
fields.schemeName: Development Support for Coffee in Traditional Areas and Non Tribal growers of Non-Traditional Area : Organic Certification / Eco certification / Natural farming
fields.briefDescription: To encourage coffee growers to improve quality for higher returns and improve access to high value specialty markets through production of organic certified coffees.

fields.schemeName: Development Support for Coffee in Traditional Areas and Non Tribal growers of Non-Traditional Area : Quality Up-gradation (QUP)
fields.briefDescription: To extend incentives to coffee holdings for creation of infrastructure facilities for production of quality coffee

fields.schemeName: Development Support for Coffee in Traditional Areas and Non-Tribal growers of Non-Traditional Area : Replantation
fields.briefDescription: To improve the production and productivity of coffee plantations by encouraging replantation of old / senile and unproductive plantations.

fields.schemeName: Market Development and Export Promotion : Kaapi Shastra Training Programme
fields.briefDescription: A distinguished programme aimed at providing a great learning opportunity for those who are passionate about coffee and coffee entrepreneurship. It is conducted in house at Coffee Quality Division of the Coffee Board, Bengaluru.

fields.schemeName: Intensive Fisheries Development Programme - Subsidy on Purchase of Fishing Nets (Scheduled Caste)
fields.briefDescription: The scheme aims to provide financial assistance to individuals from Scheduled Caste families engaged in fishing activities for the purchase of fishing nets. Under this scheme, a 60% subsidy or up to ₹24,000, on the purchase of fishing nets worth ₹40,000/- will be provided to eligible beneficiaries.

fields.schemeName: Development Support for Coffee growers of North- Eastern Region (NER) : Support for Organic / Eco Certification
fields.briefDescription: To encourage coffee growers to improve quality for higher returns and improve access to high value specialty markets through production of organically certified coffees.

fields.schemeName: Coffee Development Programme in Non-Traditional Areas (NTA) :  Support for Organic Certification
fields.briefDescription: To encourage coffee growers to improve quality for higher returns and improve access to high value specialty markets through production of organically certified coffees.

fields.schemeName: Development Support for Coffee growers of North- Eastern Region (NER) : Drying yards
fields.briefDescription: To facilitate improvement of quality of coffee produced by the growers by encouraging them to put up infrastructure for quality improvement and also facilitate them to obtain certification of their coffees, so as to enable them to earn better returns.

fields.schemeName: Technology Infusion : Block Chain Technology
fields.briefDescription: To enable coffee growers to establish direct contact with larger exporters and buyers for higher returns

fields.schemeName: PMMSY: Ice Plant/Cold Store of Minimum 20-Ton Capacity - Haryana
fields.briefDescription: The subsidy for 20-ton capacity ice plant/cold storage units under Pradhan Mantri Matsya Sampada Yojana (PMMSY) supports the establishment of ice plants or cold storage facilities with a minimum capacity of 20 tons to improve fish preservation and cold chain infrastructure in Haryana.

fields.schemeName: PMMSY: Ice Plant/Cold Store of Minimum 30-Ton Capacity - Haryana
fields.briefDescription: The subsidy for 30-ton capacity ice plants/cold storage units under Pradhan Mantri Matsya Sampada Yojana (PMMSY) supports the establishment of ice plants or cold storage facilities with a minimum capacity of 30 tons to improve fish preservation and cold chain infrastructure in Haryana.

fields.schemeName: Financial Incentive to SC Meritorious Boy Students
fields.briefDescription: The scheme provides a financial incentive of ₹5,000/- to the meritorious boys from Scheduled Castes who have secured 80% or above marks in the HSSLC examination. The objective is to motivate and encourage SC students to pursue higher studies and bring them at par with the rest.

fields.schemeName: PMMSY: Inputs for Saline /Alkaline Water Aquaculture - Haryana
fields.briefDescription: The subsidy for Inputs for Saline /Alkaline Water Aquaculture under Pradhan Mantri Matsya Sampada Yojana (PMMSY) provides input cost subsidy for saline/alkaline water aquaculture in newly created water bodies to expand fisheries production in Haryana.

fields.schemeName: PMMSY: Ice Plant/Cold Storage of Minimum 50-Ton Capacity - Haryana
fields.briefDescription: This scheme provides financial assistance for setting up ice plants or cold storage units with a minimum capacity of 50 tons, supporting cold chain infrastructure under PMMSY.

fields.schemeName: Varanasi and Amritsar Yatra Scheme
fields.briefDescription: This scheme aims to facilitate pilgrimages to Varanasi and Amritsar for individuals belonging to the Scheduled Castes category. The scheme provides financial reimbursement for second-class train travel, enabling eligible beneficiaries to undertake these religious journeys with ease.

fields.schemeName: Market Development and Export Promotion : Digital and Social Media Campaign and associated activities for the promotion of Indian Coffee including Branding and Development of Promotional materials - Films, CDs, Pamphlets etc
fields.briefDescription: To portray core strength of Indian Coffee to create a premium positioning in the global and domestic market by highlighting the uniqueness of Coffees of India

fields.schemeName: Scheme of Grants-in-Aid for supporting professional associations/ organisations of social scientists, companies and trusts duly registered under the Companies Act for their development
fields.briefDescription: The Indian Council of Social Science Research (ICSSR), under the Ministry of Education, Government of India, provides Grants-in-Aid for supporting professional associations/ organisations of social scientists, companies and trusts  for their development.

fields.schemeName: Pradhan Mantri Matsya Sampada Yojana: Medium Scale Ornamental Fish Rearing Unit (Fresh Water) - Haryana
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, financial assistance in the form of a subsidy is provided to eligible beneficiaries for setting up infrastructure such as sheds, breeding units, and rearing and culture tanks for ornamental fish.

fields.schemeName: PMMSY: Establishment of New Freshwater Fin Fish Hatcheries-Haryana
fields.briefDescription: The scheme aims to support the establishment of new freshwater finfish hatcheries. Through this scheme, financial assistance in the form of subsidies is provided to beneficiaries for setting up these hatcheries.

fields.schemeName: PMMSY: Construction of New ponds for Saline /Alkaline areas-Haryana
fields.briefDescription: The scheme aims to expand fisheries in various urban and semi-urban areas. Through this scheme, subsidies for the construction of new ponds and central financial assistance for the initial fish crop on newly constructed ponds are provided to beneficiaries.

fields.schemeName: PMMSY: Construction of Fish Kiosks Including Kiosks of Aquarium/Ornamental Fish-Haryana
fields.briefDescription: The scheme aims to provide central assistance for the construction of fish kiosks, including those for aquarium/ornamental fish.

fields.schemeName: Dr. Savita Ben Ambedkar Antarjatiya Vivah Prothsahan Yojana
fields.briefDescription: The "Dr. Savita Ben Ambedkar Antarjatiya Vivah Prothsahan Yojana" aims to eliminate caste discrimination and promote social harmony. Under this scheme, eligible inter-caste married couples receive a financial incentive.

fields.schemeName: Family Pension (BBOCWWB)
fields.briefDescription: The scheme "Family Pension" by the Bihar Building & Other Construction Workers Welfare Board (BBOCWWB), Labour Resources Department, Government of Bihar, provides pension to the dependent of the deceased pensioner of the Board.

fields.schemeName: Cash Prizes Scheme (BBOCWWB)
fields.briefDescription: "Cash Prizes Scheme" was launched by the Bihar Building & Other Construction Workers Welfare Board. Students securing 60% or more in the 10th and 12th exams receive cash prizes of up to ₹25,000/- per year. Upto two children of a registered construction worker are eligible.

fields.schemeName: Intensive Fisheries Development Programme - Subsidy on Insurance Premium for Shrimp Crop Insurance
fields.briefDescription: The scheme aims to promote sustainable aquaculture by reducing financial risk of shrimp farmers through subsidized insurance coverage.Under this scheme, a 50% subsidy is provided on insurance premium paid by eligible fish farmers for shrimp crop insurance, helping them mitigate potential crop losses

fields.schemeName: Award of Fellowship to Most Eminent Artist
fields.briefDescription: The scheme aims to honor senior eminent artists through the provision of financial assistance in the form of a monthly fellowship of ₹5,000/- for one year to support their continued contribution to the field of plastic arts.

fields.schemeName: Dr. Syama Prasad Mookerjee Durghtana Sahayta Yojana
fields.briefDescription: The scheme "Dr. Syama Prasad Mookerjee Durghtana Sahayta Yojana" by the Social Justice and Empowerment Department, Haryana , aims to provide financial assistance of ₹1,00,000 in case of accidental death or disability to residents of Haryana who are not enrolled under the PMSBY.

fields.schemeName: Solar Water Pumping System
fields.briefDescription: The scheme "Solar Water Pumping System" by the Renewable Energy Department, Government of Haryana aims to encourage the adoption of renewable energy for irrigation. Through this scheme, solar water pumps are provided at a 75% subsidy to eligible farmers and institutions for irrigation need

fields.schemeName: Solar Inverter Charger
fields.briefDescription: The "Solar Inverter Charger" by the Renewable Energy Department, Government of Haryana, aims to promote the use of renewable energy and reduce electricity dependence by providing a subsidy of ₹6,000/- or ₹10,000/- for solar inverter charger systems to eligible households.

fields.schemeName: Arogya Lakshmi
fields.briefDescription: ArogyaLaxmi is a program launched by the government of Telangana, a state in southern India, aimed at improving maternal and child health in the state. The program is designed to provide financial assistance to pregnant women and lactating mothers from economically weaker sections of society.

fields.schemeName: Ganga Kalyana Scheme
fields.briefDescription:
Ganga Kalyana Scheme is implemented by Karnataka Minorities Development Corporation Limited.
This scheme is a fully subsidized scheme, bore wells, pumps and electrification are provided to minorities, and small and marginal farmers living in rural areas.

fields.schemeName: Integrated Social Security Scheme - Women In Distress
fields.briefDescription: ISSS (Integrated Social Security Scheme) is a State Sponsored Scheme by the Social Welfare Department of the Govt. of Jammu and Kashmir where financial assistance is provided to Old Age Persons, Widows, Divorcees, Women in Distress, Transgenders, and Physically Handicapped Persons.

fields.schemeName: Dr. Ambedkar Medical Aid Scheme (Revised – 2009)
fields.briefDescription: The scheme “Dr. Ambedkar Medical Aid Scheme” has been revised and implemented by the Directorate of Welfare of Scheduled Caste & Backward Classes, Government of Haryana in 2009. Under this scheme, the state government provides medical treatment facilities to patients of the SC/ST communities.

fields.schemeName: Deen Dayal SPARSH Yojana (Scholarship For Promotion Of Aptitude & Research In Stamps As A Hobby)
fields.briefDescription: "Deen Dayal SPARSH Yojana" awards annual scholarships to students who have good academic records and are also pursuing 'Philately' as a hobby. The objective is to “Promote Philately among children at a young age in a sustainable manner that can reinforce and supplement the academic curriculum.

fields.schemeName: Dr. B. R. Ambedkar State Award To SC/ST/OBC/Minorities Students
fields.briefDescription: This scholarship aims to award the eligible meritorious students.

fields.schemeName: Ashraya Adhar Scheme
fields.briefDescription: "Ashraya Adhar Scheme" is introduced to provide financial assistance in the form of loans to the members of Scheduled Tribes for the purpose of repair, renovation/reconstruction of houses. The Goa State Scheduled Tribes Finance and Development Corporation has introduced this scheme.

fields.schemeName: Samagr Samajik Suraksha Pension Yojana
fields.briefDescription: Madhya Pradesh State Government started the "Samagr Samajik Suraksha Pension Yojana" for different age groups.

fields.schemeName: Reimbursement of Expenses for Startups Operating from Leased/Privately Owned Premises Scheme
fields.briefDescription: “Reimbursement of Expenses for Startups Operating from Leased/Privately Owned Premises Scheme” is a scheme for the Startups of Goa. The cost towards internet connectivity, software license fees and cloud services fees, will be reimbursed.
